intro: Amphilophium paniculatum var. molle, commonly known as the soft panicled amphilophium, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and panicles of small, pale yellow to greenish-white flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
